nl.weeaboo.vn.script

Interface IScriptEventDispatcher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public interface IScriptEventDispatcher
extends java.io.Serializable
    Interface for scheduling pieces of code to run on the main thread of a script context.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEvent(IScriptFunction func)
      Enqueues an event
      void addTask(IScriptFunction task, double priority)
      Registers a function that will be called every frame until it is removed with removeTask(IScriptFunction).
      boolean removeTask(IScriptFunction function)
      Cancels all active tasks for the given script function.
      java.util.List<IScriptFunction> retrieveWork()
      This method should be called once every frame.

    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        void addEvent(IScriptFunction func)
        Enqueues an event

      • addTask

        void addTask(IScriptFunction task,
             double priority)
        Registers a function that will be called every frame until it is removed with removeTask(IScriptFunction).
        Parameters:
        task - The function to call.
        priority - The relative priority of the task. Active tasks are scheduled in order of descending priority.

      • removeTask

        boolean removeTask(IScriptFunction function)
        Cancels all active tasks for the given script function.
        Returns:
        true if the task was found and removed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        addTask(IScriptFunction, double)

      • retrieveWork

        java.util.List<IScriptFunction> retrieveWork()
        This method should be called once every frame.
        Returns:
        A collection of script functions that should be executed this frame.
